conclusion: Determine how shadows will change when light source moves to back left above objects
Initial position of shadows: A is shadow of white cloth, B is shadow of magnifying glass, C is shadow of ring, D is shadow of avocado
Light source moves to the back left above the objects
Shadows will shift in opposite direction, towards the front right
Shadow A will move towards the front right, becoming longer and more elongated
Shadow B will move towards the front right, becoming more elongated
Shadow C will shift towards the front right, becoming more elongated
Shadow D will move towards the front right, becoming more elongated
Shadows will become more elongated and stretched out due to angle of light source
Shapes of shadows may change slightly depending on angle and shape of objects
Shadow A will be positioned more towards the front right of the white cloth
Shadow B will be positioned more towards the front right of the magnifying glass
Shadow C will be positioned more towards the front right of the ring
Shadow D will be positioned more towards the front right of the avocado
Shadows will shift towards the front right, becoming more elongated and stretched out
